results.title: Somerset Maugham's Quartet
results.creator_credit: Rank Film Productions, Gainsborough Pictures, Antony Darnborough, Ken Annakin, Arthur Crabtree, Harold French and Ralph Smart
results.brief_description: Somerset Maugham himself introduces these adaptations of his short stories. “The Facts of Life”: a highly entertaining story about a young man’s trip to Monte Carlo, where he ignores his father’s parting advice, and emerges from the experience better off. “The Alien Corn”: a young man (Dirk Bogarde) is determined to become a concert pianist, despite his parents’ objections. “The Kite”: Herbert’s marriage falls apart because of his obsession with flying kites. “The Colonel’s Lady”: a stuffy retired colonel is baffled by the discovery that his wife has a reputation as a passionate poetess.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rank Film Productions, Gainsborough Pictures, Antony Darnborough, Ken Annakin, Arthur Crabtree, Harold French and Ralph Smart

results.title: Someone to Love
results.creator_credit: International Rainbow Pictures, M Simonson and Henry Jaglom
results.brief_description: Danny (Henry Jaglom) invites his friends to a St. Valentine’s Day party in a disused cinema which is about to be demolished to make way for commercial development. Danny, an unrelenting romantic, in the early stages of a relationship with Helen (Anrea Marcovicci) is investigating why people feel alone. Some of the participants play themselves, others play roles. They are an assortment of Danny’s/Jaglom’s friends - actors, singers, musicians and artists. As he turns the camera on his friends and himself, the film takes an off-beat and hilarious persona akin to Gestaltian LA of the ‘70s. Orson Welles makes his final screen appearance as the omniscient bearer of wisdom.

results.title: Someone new (episode 2)
results.brief_description: Shows the growth of a baby and the birth. These events take place within the lives of three families and the birth as shown as happy and relaxed. The birth of kittens and puppies is also shown to further explain what happens when someone new is born.

results.title: Someone looks at something
results.brief_description: The title of this documentary is taken from the name that well-known Australian artist Peter Tyndall gives to all his work - `Detail’. While Peter is best known as a painter, he has also produced drawings, comic-strips, photographs, super 8 films, computer imagery, music and live performance pieces. Examining his work in a wide range of mediums since 1971, the film is also a thoughtful look at the creative process and development of an artist’s work. An excellent discussion film for upper secondary school.

results.title: Someone's in the kitchen with Jamie
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Elaine Sperber and Barra Grant
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Learning to be human”.
Relates to an adolescent boy’s struggle to remain a “boy” in the eyes of his basketball coach and team-mates, while he is undertaking a Home Economics course. Cast includes Don Kehr, Dixie Carter, William Russ.

results.title: Someday you'll find her, Charlie Brown. It's your first kiss, Charlie Brown.
results.brief_description: In “Someday you’ll find her, Charlie Brown”, Charlie becomes captivated by a beautiful girl on television. Despite Linus’ opinion that Charlie falls in love every week, he agrees to help Charlie in his mission. After many false leads and a property protected by a fierce cat, they finally track her down, only to discover she has more in common with Linus who promptly falls in love with her also. Featuring the voices of Grant Wehr, Melissa Strawmeyer, Jennifer Gaffin and Earl Reilly. Produced by Lee Mendelson and Bill Melendez. In “It’s your first kiss, Charlie Brown”, Charlie and Linus act as the queen’s attendants and Charlie is scared about the prospect of having to kiss Heather, the ‘little red-headed girl’ and homecoming queen. Featuring the voices of Arrin Skelley, Michelle Muller, Laura Planting, Ronald Hendrix and Daniel Anderson. Produced by Bill Melendez.

results.title: Somebody waiting
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles, Hal Riney and Dick Snider
results.brief_description: An evocative and poignant view of the staff of Corcoran Cottage as they attempt, with some success, to make life more stimulating and comfortable for the severely mentally and physically handicapped children of Corcoran Cottage, California.

results.title: Somebody That I Used to Know - Walk off the Earth
results.brief_description: Walk off the Earth performs a cover of Gotye’s ‘Somebody That I Used to Know’ using five people on one guitar.

constellations_other.name: Viral music videos
constellations_other.description: Gotye's 'Somebody that I used to know' was one of the internet's most viral music videos, seconded only to Queen Bey's 'Singles Ladies'.

results.title: Somebody that I used to know
results.brief_description: One of the first music videos to go viral in the age of the internet, ‘Somebody That I Used to Know’ (2011) by Gotye (and featuring Kimbra) has been viewed over 1.3 billion times on YouTube.

constellations_primary.name: Viral music videos
constellations_primary.description: Gotye's 'Somebody that I used to know' was one of the internet's most viral music videos, seconded only to Queen Bey's 'Singles Ladies'.

results.description: One of the first music videos to go viral in the age of the internet, ‘Somebody That I Used to Know’ (2011) by Gotye (and featuring Kimbra) has been viewed over 1.3 billion times on YouTube. The use of body paint and early animation technique stop motion helped drive the track to a No.1 hit in the US and Australia, as well as countless comedic parodies and rip-offs in the intervening years.
description_for_label: One of the first music videos to go viral in the age of the internet, ‘Somebody That I Used to Know’ (2011) by Gotye (and featuring Kimbra) has been viewed over 1.3 billion times on YouTube. The use of body paint and early animation technique stop motion helped drive the track to a No.1 hit in the US and Australia, as well as countless comedic parodies and rip-offs in the intervening years.
